meanings.definition: In a tyrannous manner; oppressively or unjustly.
meanings.sent1: The king ruled tyrannously, making unfair laws that oppressed the people.
meanings.sent2: She spoke tyrannously, demanding obedience without reason.
meanings.sent3: The cat tyrannously claimed the best spot on the couch, leaving the dog with no space.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged tyrannously, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The dictator ruled tyrannously, silencing any opposition with force.

meanings.sent1: The tyrannous ruler imposed harsh laws on the citizens.
meanings.sent2: Her tyrannous behavior alienated her friends.
meanings.sent3: The tyrannous toddler refused to share his toys with anyone.
meanings.sent4: The tyrannous boss micromanaged every aspect of the employees' work.
meanings.sent5: The tyrannous regime suppressed freedom of speech and assembly.
